column1: Gobernador Virasoro (formally Gobernador Ingeniero Valentín Virasoro) is a city in the province of Corrientes in the Argentine Mesopotamia. It had about 30
The city lies in the north-east of the province
column2: 64 km north from the city of Santo Tomé and 90 km from Posadas
column4: on National Route 14. The Iberá Wetlands are located 80 km to the west.

column1: Gobernador Virasoro as such was founded on 23 September 1926. The original settlement
column2: called Villa Vuelta del Ombú since the time the Jesuits established a ranch there
column3: was renamed in homage to Valentín Virasoro
column4: a field engineer who measured terrains and studied the Iberá lagoon and wetlands working for the provincial government.

column1: Municipal information: Municipal Affairs Federal Institute (IFAM)
